[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Paranoid verification disable] Does disabling paranoid_hot_potato_verification and paranoid_type_verification in test mode open Move VM vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Mempool sync manipulation] Can shared_mempool_max_concurrent_inbound_syncs be manipulated to cause race conditions in transaction ordering? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Network timeout exploitation] Are connectivity timeouts properly validated, or can malicious configs set zero timeouts causing constant network churn? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Runtime thread starvation] Can runtime_threads=1 be exploited to starve critical network operations causing consensus failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Root key exposure] Is the aptos root key (mint.key) properly protected with correct file permissions, or can it be stolen for unlimited minting? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Key serialization vulnerability] Can bcs::to_bytes() be exploited to create malformed key files that crash validators on subsequent loads? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Waypoint manipulation] Can genesis_waypoint be tampered with in the waypoint.txt file to redirect nodes to malicious chains? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Builder state injection] Can the genesis builder be manipulated through init_config callbacks to inject malicious validator state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Epoch duration manipulation] Can epoch_duration_secs=60 be set to extremely low values causing constant reconfigurations and consensus instability? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Validator allowlist bypass] Does allow_new_validators=true in test mode create security risks if accidentally enabled in production? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Lockup period exploitation] Can recurring_lockup_duration_secs be set to zero allowing instant unstaking and validator set manipulation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: configure_keyless_with_vk()] [Keyless account injection] Can environment variables ENABLE_KEYLESS_DEFAULT or INSTALL_KEYLESS_GROTH16_VK_FROM_URL be exploited to inject malicious verification keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: configure_keyless_with_vk()] [Remote VK fetching MITM] Is the HTTPS connection to api.devnet.aptoslabs.com properly verified, or can MITM attacks inject fake verification keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: configure_keyless_with_vk()] [VK file path traversal] Can INSTALL_KEYLESS_GROTH16_VK_FROM_PATH be exploited with path traversal to load arbitrary files as verification keys? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: parse_groth16_vk_from_json()] [JSON parsing vulnerabilities] Can malformed JSON in verification key data cause panics or inject malicious cryptographic parameters? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: parse_groth16_vk_from_json()] [Hex decoding exploits] Does hex::decode properly validate gamma_abc_g1 arrays, or can malformed hex cause buffer overflows? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: decode_hex_field()] [Missing field injection] Can missing verification key fields cause unwrap() panics allowing DoS attacks during node startup? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: decode_hex_field()] [Hex prefix bypass] Does hex prefix stripping properly handle edge cases, or can specially crafted inputs bypass verification? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Config merge order exploit] Can the order of config_path and test_config_override_path merging be exploited to override security-critical settings? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [YAML injection attack] Can malicious YAML in config files exploit serde_yaml deserialization to execute arbitrary code? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Config override bypass] Does merge_node_config properly validate that security-critical fields cannot be overridden? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_single_node_test_config()] [Sanitization bypass] Can config values bypass sanitize_node_config() checks to inject malicious parameters? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: load_node_config()] [Existing config tampering] If validator_config_path.exists(), can an attacker replace the file between the check and load operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-node/src/lib.rs] [Function: load_node_config()] [Config precedence confusion] Can the config loading precedence be exploited where test overrides take precedence over production configs? (Medium)
